Row.Text: Welcome to the illustrious realm of the Pala! Are you here to study, or just to marvel at what I've built?
So this is how it ends. Promise me you'll take better care of the monasteries than I did.
Fool! I may busy myself with studies, but I still know how to fight.
You are, now and forever, a welcome sight at my monasteries. If you are interested, I would be honored to make a Declaration of Friendship with you.
You are an incorrigible boor! I would demolish Nalanda if it would keep you away.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
I will reduce you to a footnote in my history books.
Our disagreements will not be resolved until you are crushed beneath my elephants.
It's odd that you claim these lands when we both know I could make better use of them.
I hope you've come to throw yourself upon my mercy.
Welcome, welcome! Your usual texts are available for perusal.
Greetings! I'll give you a moment to take in your surroundings.
Well, I see you're profaning these grounds again.
I know you're trying to provoke me, but I'll give you time to reconsider before I retaliate.
Do you come with tribute? Let's see it!
This is impossible! I'm going to fetch my strategy texts and make sure there will be no repeat of this embarrassment.
The monks abstain from luxuries, but I cannot boast their self-restraint. May I share in your wealth?
Your diplomacy is as clumsy as your warfare.
I'm sure you want to visit my glorious empire, and the feeling is mutual. Let us negotiate passage.
You are speaking to an emperor, not some common street merchant.
In lean times, even I must call upon my friends for help.
I do not listen to the empty bluster of envious men.
Is that what passes for a war in your homeland? The Pala are made of sterner stuff.
Once again, my triumph is proven. You are, of course, welcome to pay homage.
